meanings.definition: Having a slanting edge or surface for joining two surfaces at an angle.
meanings.sent1: The bevelled mirror added a stylish touch to the room.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used a bevelled ruler to measure the angles.
meanings.sent3: The bevelled picture frame made the painting look like it was leaning.
meanings.sent4: Her bevelled smile gave her face a unique charm.
meanings.sent5: The bevelled roof of the house caught the sunlight beautifully.

meanings.definition: To cut or shape an edge at an angle.
meanings.sent1: He carefully bevelled the edges of the wood for a perfect fit.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor bevelled the marble to create intricate details.
meanings.sent3: She bevelled the cake edges to give it a fancy look.
meanings.sent4: The artist bevelled the paper to start his origami project.
meanings.sent5: Bevelled edges make the furniture look more polished and refined.
